meanings.definition: A person who speaks softly or in a hushed tone.
meanings.sent1: The librarian was known as the whisperer in the library.
meanings.sent2: The whisperer at the concert ensured the audience remained quiet.
meanings.sent3: The whisperer at the party made everyone lean in to hear the secret jokes.
meanings.sent4: She was a whisperer of secrets, her words barely audible but full of meaning.
meanings.sent5: The forest was silent except for the whisperer of the wind through the leaves.

meanings.definition: A person who communicates with animals in a gentle manner.
meanings.sent1: The horse whisperer calmed the wild stallion with his gentle words.
meanings.sent2: The animal whisperer had a special bond with all creatures big and small.
meanings.sent3: The bird whisperer sang melodies that only the birds could understand.
meanings.sent4: She was a whisperer to the timid kitten, coaxing it out of its hiding spot.
meanings.sent5: The dolphin whisperer could understand the clicks and whistles of the marine mammals.
